clusters.title: Finnish authorities seize vessel suspected of damaging Baltic undersea cable
clusters.neutral_headline: Finnish police seize vessel suspected of damaging underwater cable
bullet_summary: Finnish coastguard officers boarded the ship at 11am, about six hours after disruption to the cables was first reported
Reported by Reuters Top News, Guardian World, BBC World and others

items.title: Finnish authorities seize vessel suspected of damaging Baltic undersea cable
items.standfirst: The Commission is monitoring the case, which is suspected as another instance of hybrid warfare
items.content: The Commission is monitoring the case, which is suspected as another instance of hybrid warfare

items.title: Finnish police seize vessel suspected of damaging underwater cable
items.standfirst: Border guards say they found ship with anchor lowered into sea after detection of fault in Helsinki-Tallinn telecoms link Finnish authorities have boarded and seized a cargo vessel sailing from Russia on suspicion of sabotaging two underwater telecommunications cables in the Baltic Sea, where a series of similar incidents have occurred in recent years.The vessel, the Fitburg, was on its way from St Petersburg to Haifa in Israel. Finnish coastguard officers boarded the ship at 11am, about six hours after disruption to the cables was first reported. Fourteen crew members, including several Russians, were taken into custody. Continue reading...
items.content: Border guards say they found ship with anchor lowered into sea after detection of fault in Helsinki-Tallinn telecoms link Finnish authorities have boarded and seized a cargo vessel sailing from Russia on suspicion of sabotaging two underwater telecommunications cables in the Baltic Sea, where a series of similar incidents have occurred in recent years.The vessel, the Fitburg, was on its way from St Petersburg to Haifa in Israel. Finnish coastguard officers boarded the ship at 11am, about six hours after disruption to the cables was first reported. Fourteen crew members, including several Russians, were taken into custody. Continue reading...

items.title: Finnish police seize ship suspected of sabotaging undersea cable
items.standfirst: Police arrested 14 crew members on the ship sailing from the St Petersburg to the Israeli port of Haifa.
items.content: Police arrested 14 crew members on the ship sailing from the St Petersburg to the Israeli port of Haifa.

items.title: Finland seizes ship sailing from Russia after suspected undersea cable sabotage

items.title: New Year's Eve celebrations kick off as 2026 arrives around the world
items.standfirst: New Zealand and Australia were among the first to welcome 2026, but in Sydney and some other cities, the festivities are tinged by grief.
items.content: New Zealand and Australia were among the first to welcome 2026, but in Sydney and some other cities, the festivities are tinged by grief.

items.title: Fireworks, drums and light shows: How the world is welcoming 2026
items.standfirst: Countries around the world celebrated the new year with colourful shows and long held traditions.
items.content: Countries around the world celebrated the new year with colourful shows and long held traditions.

items.title: In pictures: Sydney helps kick off celebrations as world ushers in 2026
items.standfirst: Australia, New Zealand and several eastern Asian nations were the first countries to ring in 2026 with spectacular fireworks displays. The rest of Asia, Africa and Europe will be the next regions to watch as the countdown clock ticks down to midnight.
items.content: Australia, New Zealand and several eastern Asian nations were the first countries to ring in 2026 with spectacular fireworks displays. The rest of Asia, Africa and Europe will be the next regions to watch as the countdown clock ticks down to midnight.

items.content: The search for the wreckage of Malaysia Airlines Flight 370 is set to resume Tuesday, more than a decade after the plane went missing with 239 people onboard in one of the world’s greatest aviation mysteries.

items.title: Russia says 'no evidence needed' to accuse Ukraine of drone attack on Putin's residence
items.standfirst: Ukraine said Tuesday there was no "plausible" evidence it launched a drone attack on one of Russian President Vladimir Putin's residences, and accused Moscow of peddling falsehoods to influence peace talks. Story by Laurent Berstecher.
items.content: Ukraine said Tuesday there was no "plausible" evidence it launched a drone attack on one of Russian President Vladimir Putin's residences, and accused Moscow of peddling falsehoods to influence peace talks. Story by Laurent Berstecher.

items.title: Alleged drone attack on a Putin residence offers the Kremlin a timely narrative shift
items.standfirst: Russia has accused Ukraine of targeting one Putin's presidential palaces with drones in a bid to disrupt peace talks. Analysts say it may have been engineered.
items.content: Russia has accused Ukraine of targeting one Putin's presidential palaces with drones in a bid to disrupt peace talks. Analysts say it may have been engineered.

Apollo to Sell Coinstar to Alaska Buyer, Bonds Set to Be Repaid
items.standfirst: Coinstar LLC, the coin-exchange and cryptocurrency business owned by Apollo Global Management Inc., plans to repay bondholders next month as part of its surprise sale to a company that oversees investments for natives of Alaska’s far north, according to people familiar with the matter.
items.content: Coinstar LLC, the coin-exchange and cryptocurrency business owned by Apollo Global Management Inc., plans to repay bondholders next month as part of its surprise sale to a company that oversees investments for natives of Alaska’s far north, according to people familiar with the matter.

bullet_summary: Reported by Reuters Top News, Guardian World

items.title: Tesla makes surprise announcement of lower than expected sales for 2025
items.standfirst: Tesla has taken the unusual step of publishing sales forecasts that suggest 2025 deliveries will be lower than expected and future years’ sales will be well below targets set by its chief executive, Elon Musk. The US electric vehicle maker published figures from analysts suggesting it will…
items.content: Tesla has taken the unusual step of publishing sales forecasts that suggest 2025 deliveries will be lower than expected and future years’ sales will be well below targets set by its chief executive, Elon Musk. The US electric vehicle maker published figures from analysts suggesting it will…

items.title: Tesla publishes analyst forecasts suggesting sales set to fall
items.standfirst: Tesla endured tough year in part thanks to some consumers’ distaste for Elon Musk’s embrace of rightwing politicsTesla has taken the unusual step of publishing sales forecasts that suggest 2025 deliveries will be lower than expected and future years’ sales will be well below targets set by its chief executive, Elon Musk.The US electric vehicle maker published figures from analysts suggesting it will announce 423,000 deliveries during the fourth quarter of 2025, in a new “consensus” section on its investor website. That would represent a 16% decline from the final quarter of 2024. Continue reading...
items.content: Tesla endured tough year in part thanks to some consumers’ distaste for Elon Musk’s embrace of rightwing politicsTesla has taken the unusual step of publishing sales forecasts that suggest 2025 deliveries will be lower than expected and future years’ sales will be well below targets set by its chief executive, Elon Musk.The US electric vehicle maker published figures from analysts suggesting it will announce 423,000 deliveries during the fourth quarter of 2025, in a new “consensus” section on its investor website. That would represent a 16% decline from the final quarter of 2024. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Eurostar slowly resumes but passengers face more cancellations and delays
clusters.neutral_headline: Eurostar slowly resumes but passengers face more cancellations and delays
bullet_summary: Reported by Guardian World, France24

items.title: Eurostar slowly resumes but passengers face more cancellations and delays
items.standfirst: Passengers told to expect knock-on impacts after power supply problem and broken-down train halted services on TuesdayRail traffic through the Channel tunnel slowly resumed on Wednesday with more cancellations and delays after an electricity failure on Tuesday stranded thousands of passengers and trapped some for a night in a powerless train.Two London-Paris trains were cancelled and most trips were delayed in both directions as Eurostar warned of “knock-on impacts” on New Year’s Eve. Continue reading...
items.content: Passengers told to expect knock-on impacts after power supply problem and broken-down train halted services on TuesdayRail traffic through the Channel tunnel slowly resumed on Wednesday with more cancellations and delays after an electricity failure on Tuesday stranded thousands of passengers and trapped some for a night in a powerless train.Two London-Paris trains were cancelled and most trips were delayed in both directions as Eurostar warned of “knock-on impacts” on New Year’s Eve. Continue reading...

items.title: Eurostar to return to normal after massive power supply leaves travellers stranded
items.standfirst: A power failure in the Channel Tunnel suspended holiday plans for thousands of Eurostar passengers on Tuesday, after services between London and the continent were suspended for hours. Although train services were slowly returning to normal by Tuesday evening, many passengers had already postponed the plans at a peak time for travel. Details by Andrew Hilliar and Ludovic de Foucaud.
items.content: A power failure in the Channel Tunnel suspended holiday plans for thousands of Eurostar passengers on Tuesday, after services between London and the continent were suspended for hours. Although train services were slowly returning to normal by Tuesday evening, many passengers had already postponed the plans at a peak time for travel. Details by Andrew Hilliar and Ludovic de Foucaud.

items.title: Sydney remembers Bondi Beach victims during New Year's celebration

items.content: As it counted down to 2026, Sydney held a moment of silent remembrance for the victims of the Bondi Beach attack that happened earlier this month. Since the attack, Australian authorities have increased police presence across the city. Ramy Inocencio reports.

items.title: Moment of silence for Bondi Beach shooting victims before New Year in Sydney

items.content: Sydney held a moment of silence for the 15 people killed in a terrorist attack at a Hanukkah event on Bondi Beach before it celebrated the New Year with fireworks in its harbor.
